name: DMX
tagline: Discrete-Event Simulation Modelling Framework with Extensibility
body:
### Welcome to the DMX information page

DMX is a framework which facilitates efficient development of domain-specific simulation modelling languages and tools. It is developed as a set of Eclipse plugins running under Eclipse Version 3.7 Indigo.

The following Eclipse plugins are required by DMX:
- Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF),
- [Acceleo](http://www.eclipse.org/acceleo/) Version 3.2 or higher, available from [this Eclipse Update Site](http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/m2t/acceleo/updates/releases/3.2),
- and [Textual Editing Framework (TEF)](http://www.markus-scheidgen.de/software-projects/427-2/), available from [this Eclipse Update Site](http://tef.berlios.de/updatesite).

DMX is an academic project. We try to have a stable running version in the latest commit. However, there might be some things not working from time to time. The purpose is to show the principle working of the framework.

In order to use DMX, you should import its plugins into your own Eclipse workspace. The contents provided at GitHub are listed below.

### Contents

- The folder [dev-plugins](https://github.com/ablunk/dmx/tree/master/dev-plugins) contains the framework as a set of Eclipse plugins. These plugins should be imported into your Eclipse workspace.
- The folder [runtime-plugins](https://github.com/ablunk/dmx/tree/master/runtime-plugins) contains an example project with a lot of [DMX models](https://github.com/ablunk/dmx/tree/master/runtime-plugins/Examples/src-dmx). The project should be imported into the workspace of a second running Eclipse initiated from the first one.
  - The **State Machine Language (SML)** used in a paper which will be presented at the [SDL Forum 2013](http://users.encs.concordia.ca/~magic/sdl2013/) (June 26-28) is available [here](https://github.com/ablunk/dmx/tree/master/runtime-plugins/Examples/src-dmx/sdl2013).

### Documentation

- [Workbench Overview](http://github.com/ablunk/dmx/raw/gh-pages/dmx-workbench.pdf)
- [Internal Workflow for Executing Base Language Models with Extensions (DBX Files)](http://github.com/ablunk/dmx/raw/gh-pages/dmx-workflow.pdf)

#### Papers

- Blunk, A., Fischer, J.: [Prototyping Domain Specific Languages as Extensions of a General Purpose Language.](http://www.mendeley.com/research/prototyping-domain-specific-languages-as-extensions-of-a-general-purpose-language-1/) In: 7th System Analysis and Modeling Workshop, Springer (2012)

#### Videos

- Definition of a simple extension: [![Forever-Preview](http://raw.github.com/ablunk/dmx/gh-pages/forever-preview.png)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=shNhaSriWUE&hd=1)

### Contact
